{{Day}}

==Events==
*[[1066]] &ndash; [[Harold Godwinson]] (or Harold II) is crowned King of [[England]].
*[[1118]] &ndash; [[Reconquista]]: [[Alfonso the Battler]] conquers [[Zaragoza]].
*[[1205]] &ndash; [[Philip of Swabia]] becomes [[King of the Romans]].
*[[1322]] &ndash; [[Stephen Uroš III Dečanski of Serbia|Stephen Uroš III]] is crowned [[Kingdom of Serbia (medieval)|King of Serbia]].
*[[1355]] &ndash; [[Charles IV, Holy Roman Emperor|Charles I of Bohemia]] is crowned with the [[Iron Crown of Lombardy]] as [[King of Italy]] in [[Milan]].
*[[1449]] &ndash; [[Constantine XI Palaiologos|Constantine XI]] is crowned [[List of Byzantine emperors|Byzantine Emperor]] at [[Mystras]].
*[[1492]] &ndash; [[Ferdinand and Isabella]] The Catholic Monarchs enter [[Granada]], completing the [[Reconquista]].
*[[1540]] &ndash; King [[Henry VIII of England]] marries [[Anne of Cleves]].
*[[1579]] &ndash; The [[Union of Arras]] is signed.
*[[1661]] &ndash; [[Restoration (England)|English Restoration]]: The [[Fifth Monarchists]] unsuccessfully attempt to seize control of [[London|London, England]].
*[[1690]] &ndash; [[Joseph I, Holy Roman Emperor|Joseph]], son of [[Leopold I, Holy Roman Emperor|Emperor Leopold I]], becomes King of the Romans.
*[[1721]] &ndash; The Committee of Inquiry on the [[South Sea Company|South Sea Bubble]] publishes its findings.
*[[1781]] &ndash; In the [[Battle of Jersey]], the [[Great Britain|British]] defeat the last attempt by [[France]] to invade Jersey.
*[[1809]] &ndash; Combined British, Portuguese and colonial Brazilian forces begin the [[Invasion of Cayenne (1809)|Invasion of Cayenne]] during the [[Napoleonic Wars]].
*[[1838]] &ndash; [[Alfred Vail]] demonstrates a [[telegraphy|telegraph]] system using dots and dashes (this is the forerunner of [[Morse code]]).
*[[1839]] &ndash; The [[Night of the Big Wind|most damaging storm in 300 years]] sweeps across [[Ireland]], damaging or destroying more than 20% of the houses in [[Dublin]].
*[[1853]] &ndash; [[President-elect of the United States]] [[Franklin Pierce]] and [[Jane Pierce|his family]] are involved in a [[train wreck]] near [[Andover, Massachusetts]]. Pierce's 11-year-old son Benjamin is killed in the crash.
*[[1870]] &ndash; The inauguration of the [[Musikverein]] in [[Vienna|Vienna, Austria]].
*[[1893]] &ndash; The [[Washington National Cathedral]] is chartered by [[United States Congress|Congress]]. The charter is signed by [[President of the United States|President]] [[Benjamin Harrison]].
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Second Boer War]]: Having already [[Siege of Ladysmith|sieged]] the fortress at [[Ladysmith, KwaZulu-Natal|Ladysmith]], [[Boer]] forces attack it, but are driven back by [[United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland|British]] defenders.
*[[1907]] &ndash; [[Maria Montessori]] opens her first school and daycare center for [[working class]] children in [[Rome|Rome, Italy]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[New Mexico]] is admitted as the 47th [[U.S. state]].
*  1912   &ndash; [[Germany|German]] [[Geophysics|geophysicist]] [[Alfred Wegener]] first presents his theory of [[continental drift]].
*[[1921]] &ndash; Formation of the [[Iraqi Army]].
*[[1929]] &ndash; King [[Alexander I of Yugoslavia|Alexander of the Serbs, Croats and Slovenes]] suspends [[Kingdom of Yugoslavia|his country]]'s constitution (the [[6 January Dictatorship|January 6th Dictatorship]]).
*  1929   &ndash; [[Mother Teresa]] arrives in [[Kolkata|Calcutta, India]] to begin her work among [[India]]'s poorest and sick people.
*[[1930]] &ndash; The first [[Diesel engine|diesel]]-engined [[automobile]] trip is completed, from [[Indianapolis|Indianapolis, Indiana]], to [[New York City|New York, New York]].
*[[1931]] &ndash; [[Thomas Edison]] submits his last [[patent]] application.
*[[1941]] &ndash; United States President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] delivers his [[Four Freedoms]] speech in the [[State of the Union address]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; [[Pan American World Airways|Pan American Airlines]] becomes the first commercial airline to schedule a flight around the world.
*[[1950]] &ndash; The United Kingdom recognizes the [[People's Republic of China]]. The [[Republic of China]] severs diplomatic relations with the UK in response.
*[[1951]] &ndash; [[Ganghwa massacre]]: [[Korean War]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; The first [[Asian Socialist Conference]] opens in [[Yangon|Rangoon, Burma]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[National Airlines Flight 2511]] is destroyed in mid-air by a bomb, while en route from New York City to [[Miami|Miami, Florida]].
*  1960   &ndash; The [[Associations Law]] comes into force in [[Iraq]], allowing registration of political parties.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: [[United States Marine Corps]] and [[Army of the Republic of Vietnam|ARVN]] troops launch "[[Operation Deckhouse Five]]" in the [[Mekong]] River delta.
*[[1974]] &ndash; In response to the [[1973 oil crisis]], [[daylight saving time]] commences nearly four months early in the [[United States]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; The [[Holy Crown of Hungary|Crown of St. Stephen]] (also known as the Holy Crown of Hungary) is returned to [[Hungary]] from the United States, where it was held after [[World War II]].
*[[1992]] &ndash; [[President of Georgia]] [[Zviad Gamsakhurdia]] flees the country as a result of the military [[Coup d'état|coup]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; Indian [[Border Security Force]] units [[Sopore massacre|kill 55 Kashmiri civilians]] in [[Sopore]], [[Jammu and Kashmir]], in revenge after militants ambushed a BSF patrol.
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Nancy Kerrigan]] is clubbed on the knee at the [[United States Figure Skating Championships|U.S. Figure Skating Championships]] in [[Detroit|Detroit, Michigan]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; A chemical fire in an apartment complex in [[Manila|Manila, Philippines]], leads to the discovery of plans for [[Bojinka plot|Project Bojinka]], a mass-terrorist attack.
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[African-American Civil Rights Movement (1955–1968)|American Civil Rights Movement]]: [[Edgar Ray Killen]] is arrested as a suspect in the 1964 [[Mississippi civil rights workers murders|murders of three civil rights workers]].
*  2005   &ndash; A [[Graniteville train disaster|train collision]] in [[Graniteville, South Carolina]], releases about 60 tons of [[chlorine]] gas.
*[[2009]]  &ndash; Israel conducts an assault on Gaza. [[Operation Cast Lead]]
